title: Trump's tariffs cause global shockwaves, but India may be among least vulnerable
content: US President Donald Trump has announced reciprocal tariff on all foreign goods starting April 2025. This move could potentially shake up global trade dynamics. However, experts suggest India may experience minimal impact.

title: Annamalai says not in race for TN chief post: Is BJP eyeing AIADMK tie-up?
content: The BJP in Tamil Nadu may be adjusting its political strategy, as state BJP president K Annamalai announced he is not contesting for re-election. This development follows Annamalai's controversial comments about late AIADMK leader Jayalalithaa and potential talks of reviving a BJP-AIADMK alliance ahead of the assembly elections.

title: Russia strikes Zelenskyy's hometown, kills 14
content: A Russian missile strike in Kryvyi Rig, Ukraine, killed 14 people and injured over 50, with the attack involving residential areas. President Zelenskyy stated that Russia seeks war and urged international pressure to end the conflict, emphasizing that the US, Europe, and global efforts are vital for peace.

title: Microsoft VP tells Google employees: Don't come to me for jobs, go to….
content: Microsoft AI VP Nando de Freitas acknowledged Google's DeepMind for its new AI models while addressing restrictive employment contracts at DeepMind. He received multiple requests for help from distressed DeepMind employees regarding notice periods and noncompete agreements but directed them to internal leadership instead.

title: Digvesh Rathi courts controversy again with fiery send-off against MI
content: Lucknow Super Giants spinner Digvesh Rathi made headlines again for his celebratory send-off after dismissing Mumbai Indians' Naman Dhir. Despite a prior fine for a similar action, Rathi repeated his aggressive celebration, leading to debate over potential further disciplinary action. With two send-offs in consecutive games, Rathi's behaviour may prompt sterner consequences from the league.

title: Centre downgrades security cover for ex-PM Manmohan Singh's wife
content: The Centre has downgraded Gursharan Kaur's security cover from Z-plus to Z, following a review of her threat perception. This change comes after the passing of former PM Manmohan Singh in 2024. CRPF will continue to provide protection, albeit with fewer personnel and a scaled-down protocol.

title: Europe may fine Elon Musk's X more than $1 billion
content: EU regulators are set to impose hefty penalties on Elon Musk's X platform for breaching the Digital Services Act, targeting illegal content and disinformation. A fine exceeding $1 billion is speculated, aiming to deter non-compliance by other companies. The investigation highlights X's inadequate content moderation, contributing to the spread of harmful content in the EU.

title: Protests & petitions: Multipronged oppn erupts against Waqf Bill
content: The Waqf Amendment Bill 2025 sparked large-scale protests across India, including Ahmedabad, Kolkata, and Chennai, after it cleared Parliament. Leaders of AIMIM and Congress challenged its constitutionality in the Supreme Court. The Opposition and several leaders criticized the Bill's passage and its potential impact on religious rights.

title: LinkedIn co-founder to employees: Go home, have dinner with family
content: LinkedIn co-founder Reid Hoffman has defended the intense work ethic required for startup success, emphasizing that employees needed to continue working after family dinners during the company's early days. Hoffman argues that work-life balance is not feasible in startups, highlighting the significant rewards for those who embrace the demanding culture.

title: Will Cody Bellinger play today against Pittsburgh Pirates? Latest update
content: The New York Yankees are awaiting the final decision on Cody Bellinger's availability for today's game against the Pittsburgh Pirates due to a recent hamstring strain. Bellinger has been undergoing light training, and a last-minute check-up will determine his participation.

title: Rohit Sharma's knee injury raises concerns as viral video sparks worry
content: Rohit Sharma missed the crucial IPL 2025 match against Lucknow Super Giants due to a knee injury sustained during practice. The incident raised concerns after visuals of him struggling surfaced online. MI shifted their strategy under Hardik Pandya's captaincy, who achieved a remarkable five-wicket haul amidst the swirling questions on Rohit's fitness.

title: Hardik Pandya creates history, becomes first IPL captain to take a fifer
content: Mumbai Indians captain Hardik Pandya made history by becoming the first IPL captain to take a five-wicket haul. He took 5 wickets for 36 runs against Lucknow Super Giants. Pandya's spell was crucial in restricting LSG to a total of 203/8. This achievement is the best T20 performance of his career.

title: 'China played it wrong, panicked': Trump on Beijing's retaliatory tariff
content: US President Donald Trump criticized China's decision to impose a 34% tariff on all US imports, claiming China 'panicked' in response to his recent trade measures. China's finance ministry confirmed the tariffs as reciprocal. The tensions include higher tariffs on imports from the European Union, Japan, and Israel, with Trump declaring a national emergency to enforce his policy.

title: China shift: Why PM Modi's Sri Lanka trip is crucial
content: Prime Minister Modi is visiting Sri Lanka to enhance defence ties and cooperation in energy, trade, and connectivity. The visit marks his first engagement with Sri Lankan President Anura Kumara Dissanayaka. China's growing influence in the Indian Ocean region has heightened the significance of closer India-Sri Lanka relations.

title: US markets tumble, Trump says 'some pain' is worth it
content: Global stock markets plummeted after China retaliated against the US with significant new tariffs, heightening fears of a global recession. The S&P 500 experienced its worst drop since 2020, while the Dow and Nasdaq also saw significant declines. Heavy losses were seen across US companies with significant exposure to China.

title: Tariff war: China targets US defence sector, curbs mineral export
content: China has expanded its export restrictions on critical minerals in retaliation to US tariffs. Key materials like rare earth elements now have tighter controls, impacting high-tech industries and defence sectors globally. The move is aimed at leveraging China's dominance in the global mineral supply chain.

title: Rishabh Pant's horror run continues with another cheap dismissal - Watch
content: Lucknow Super Giants' captain Rishabh Pant continued to struggle in IPL 2025, scoring just 2 runs against Mumbai Indians. This marks his third single-digit score in four games. Despite a strong start by openers Mitchell Marsh and Aiden Markram, Pant was dismissed by Hardik Pandya, further frustrating fans and team owner Sanjeev Goenka.

title: Wall Street plunge pushes ‘fear gauge’ to 8-month high
content: Wall Street's 'fear gauge' surged to eight-month high as US stocks plummeted following China's new tariffs on all US goods, escalating trade tensions after Trump's tariff announcement. Global markets suffered significant losses, with European and Asian indices dropping sharply. The market turmoil raised fears of a recession, despite strong US hiring numbers.

title: Rs 10 lakh cr investor wealth gone! 4 reasons why Sensex crashed today
content: Indian stock market indices, BSE Sensex and Nifty50, suffered significant declines on Friday, triggered by US recession fears and new tariffs announced by American President Donald Trump.

title: 'Job, jobs, jobs': Trump's admin hails 'explosive' growth
content: The US economy exceeded job growth expectations in March, adding 228,000 jobs, largely driven by private sector gains in retail, transportation, and construction. The increase in full-time workers and rising nominal hourly wages signal economic strength, though analysts warn of potential impacts from Trump's tariffs.

title: IPL 2025: Why Rohit Sharma not playing against LSG
content: Mumbai Indians star opener Rohit Sharma has been ruled out of a crucial match against Lucknow Super Giants due to a knee injury. With MI struggling in the season, Hardik Pandya has focused on adaptation and execution. The team hopes Rohit's injury is minor and not indicative of a prolonged absence.

title: Hardik Pandya breaks silence on Jasprit Bumrah: 'He should be ...'
content: Mumbai Indians captain Hardik Pandya provided an update on Jasprit Bumrah, who is undergoing rehabilitation and is expected to return soon. Rohit Sharma missed the IPL 2025 match against Lucknow Super Giants due to a knee injury. Hardik opted to bowl first after winning the toss. Key players from both teams featured in the playing XI.

title: Crisis in JD(U)? 5 leaders quit party as Parliament passes Waqf Bill
content: Not one or two but at least five leaders submitted their resignations as the bill was passed, first in Lok Sabha and then the Rajya Sabha on Thursday and Friday, respectively.  ​The latest to resign from the party was Nadeem Akhtar, his resignation follows that of four other leaders, including JD(U) leader Raju Nayyar, Tabrez Siddiqui Alig, Mohammad Shahnawaz Malik, and Mohammed Kasim Ansari.

title: Hindu temple vandalised in Canada, police release photo of two suspects
content: Canadian police have released images of two suspects involved in vandalizing the Sri Krishna Brundavana Temple. The suspects damaged the temple's sign in the early hours of March 30. Security footage showed them desecrating the sign and shouting offensive remarks, including 'F****** terrorists.'

title: Video of Rahane punishing Jaiswal for 'discipline issues' goes viral
content: Ajinkya Rahane disciplined Yashasvi Jaiswal during the 2022 Duleep Trophy final, sending him off the field for aggressive sledging. The resurfaced video coincides with Jaiswal’s switch from Mumbai to Goa for the 2025–26 season. Jaiswal’s move is seen as a major boost for Goa, highlighting his fiery ambition and Rahane’s influence on his discipline.

title: Vitamin D, combined with this nutrient slows ageing and helps live longer
content: Though ageing can't be stopped, it might be possible to slow it down.  Vitamin D, with this nutrient and regular strength training each support healthy ageing in different ways—and together, they could help the body stay younger for longer. While more research is on the way, these findings are a reminder that small, everyday choices can have lasting impacts on health.

title: How Star Wars predicted Trump's trade wars
content: On April 2, 2025, Donald Trump announced sweeping "reciprocal tariffs" on over 60 countries, triggering a wave of Star Wars: The Phantom Menace memes that turned satire into prophecy. Internet users invoked Trade Federation blockades, Queen Amidala’s warnings, and Palpatine’s power grabs to make sense of Trump’s tariff regime, which bypasses Congress via executive authority. The film, once mocked for its political themes, now feels eerily prescient. As global trade convulses and Walmart prices rise, memes have become both coping mechanism and analysis. In a world of penguin tariffs and populist economics, maybe George Lucas was right all along.

title: MS Dhoni to return as Chennai Super Kings captain?
content: CSK's batting coach Michael Hussey hints at a leadership change for their IPL match against Delhi Capitals, opening the possibility of MS Dhoni returning as captain if Ruturaj Gaikwad is unable to play due to injury. With Gaikwad's participation uncertain, there is speculation that a young wicketkeeper might also fill in.

title: 'We've food apps, China has ... ': Piyush Goyal's startup reality check
content: Union Minister Piyush Goyal highlighted the disparity between Indian and Chinese startups, emphasizing that while Indian startups focus on food delivery and fantasy sports apps, Chinese startups concentrate on advanced technologies like EVs, AI, and semiconductors. He called for more domestic investment and innovation in the Indian startup ecosystem.

title: Golden State Warriors final injury report: Stephen Curry play tonight?
content: Golden State Warriors' Stephen Curry will play in the crucial game against the Denver Nuggets, following his impressive performance against the LA Lakers. While Curry is fit, Gary Payton II remains out. With Denver facing multiple injuries, including a questionable Nikola Jokic, tonight's game could shift in favor of the Warriors.

title: 'Dark chapter in federalism': Stalin slams Centre after anti-NEET Bill rejected
content: Tamil Nadu's Chief Minister MK Stalin declared the Centre's rejection of the state's Bill seeking NEET exemption a 'dark chapter in federalism.' The Bill, which aimed to base medical admissions on Class 12 marks, was rejected despite the state's clarifications. An all-party meeting is planned to decide the next steps.

title: Deposit PPF money by April 5 to get this big benefit
content: To maximize benefits from PPF investments, ensure deposits are made by April 5 each year, as interest calculation is based on the minimum balance between the 5th and month's end. A timely deposit enhances returns, with tardy contributions resulting in interest loss.

title: 'Avoid rhetoric that vitiates environment': PM Modi tells Yunus
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi met Muhammad Yunus, chief adviser of Bangladesh's interim government, at the Bimstec Summit in Bangkok. Modi raised concerns over minority safety in Bangladesh and urged a thorough investigation of related incidents. He highlighted the significance of regional peace and constructive bilateral relations.

title: 'Main gangster hota': Pak cricketer's comment leaves everyone in splits
content: Pakistan spinner Sajid Khan humorously remarked he would have been a gangster if not a cricketer. In an interview, he made the tongue-in-cheek comment, bringing laughter. Sajid, known for his off-spin, praised Babar Azam and Virat Kohli while showcasing his wit and lighter side, continuing to entertain both on and off the field.

title: Dawn Staley's road to Tampa begins in Philadelphia
content: No matter where she has called home, the Final Four coach's story is held close by those who watched her rise.

title: Hunter marks quiet day at Colorado Showcase
content: Hundreds of NFL talent evaluators descended on the Buffaloes' campus for the Colorado Showcase, but they were getting a limited look at best at Heisman Trophy winner Travis Hunter.

title: Flagg 4th freshman named AP Player of the Year
content: Duke star Cooper Flagg becomes just the fourth freshman to win AP men's college basketball Player of the Year award.

title: Ravens' Jackson, Earnhardt Jr. in trademark beef
content: Ravens quarterback Lamar Jackson is in a trademark dispute with NASCAR star Dale Earnhardt Jr. over the right to use a stylized version of the No. 8.

title: NBA fines Morant $75K for finger-gun gestures
content: The NBA has fined Memphis Grizzlies guard Ja Morant $75,000 mimicking shooting a gun with his finger twice while on the court, the league announced Friday.

title: Pearl, Pitino share AP coach award in first-ever tie
content: The successes this season by Bruce Pearl at Auburn and Rick Pitino at St. John's led to the first tie in the 58-year history of The Associated Press men's college basketball Coach of the Year award.

title: Two-time MVP Delle Donne retires from WNBA
content: Two-time WNBA MVP Elena Delle Donne has retired from basketball, saying her body "seemed to make this decision before my mind accepted it" in an Instagram post.

title: Sources: PGA Tour rejects PIF's recent $1.5B offer
content: The PGA Tour has rejected PIF's most recent offer to invest $1.5 billion into PGA Tour Enterprises, the tour's for-profit entity, which came with the caveat that the rival LIV Golf League would remain intact, sources confirmed to ESPN.

title: Caps goalie Thompson to miss at least 2 games
content: Capitals goaltender Logan Thompson is expected to miss at least a couple of games because of injury, coach Spencer Carbery said Friday.

title: 'What the heck have we done?' Inside 48 hours of torpedo bat madness
content: From a comment on a Yankees broadcast to a rush of new bat orders, here's how MLB's hottest trend took off.

title: Breaking down all four women's Final Four teams -- and predicting the 2025 national champion
content: No. 1 seeds UCLA, South Carolina and Texas advanced to Tampa. But 2-seed UConn has momentum and experience.

title: Johni Broome could be 'the most impactful transfer in college basketball history'
content: The SEC Player of the Year is chasing history -- for himself and Auburn -- as the Tigers head into Final Four.

title: Duke's baton now fully passed from Coach K to Jon Scheyer
content: Mike Krzyzewski's emergence from the shadows is the ultimate sign that the baton in Durham has been passed.

title: How Nikola Jokic quietly became a defensive analytics darling
content: From kicked ball violations to memorizing plays, Jokic has become one of the league's best defenders.

title: Life after OMG: Can 2025 Mets replicate their 2024 vibes?
content: After signing a superstar but losing a pop star, the Mets aim to make Citi Field twist again like it did last summer.

title: First impressions from the Athletics' new home opener
content: How the players, fans and staff handled the first of many games in their minor league stadium residency.

title: Playoff watch: Last stand for the Red Wings?
content: It's close to do-or-die time for Dylan Larkin & Co. Plus, updated playoff bracket, draft lottery projections.

title: Every way to bet on Alex Ovechkin's goals record chase
content: Alex Ovechkin is one of the hottest NHL bets, here are the special markets bettors can bet on as he closes in on the goals scored record.

title: Tatum? Pippen? NBA execs share best comps for projected No. 1 pick Cooper Flagg
content: Ahead of the Final Four, NBA execs share their comparisons for the Duke star and projected No. 1 draft pick.

title: Brooklyn to Indiana: Darryn Peterson's 48-hour run
content: After shining in the McDonald's All American Game, the Kansas commit inspired a Chipotle Nationals win.

title: Safety? Aesthetics? Competitive advantage? The real reasons some teams want to ban the tush push
content: It wasn't just about a polarizing on-field rule. It was a window into the back-channel politics of the rules process.

title: Why the Manchester derby lost its cachet, and how it might be coming back around
content: Sunday's Manchester derby will be the lowest-key edition in some time. How did we get here, and when might it get back to the thrilling matchup it once was?

title: Amorim: 'Crazy' to believe Man Utd could win Prem
content: Ruben Amorim said he would be "crazy" to think Manchester United can win the Premier League next season.

title: Ancelotti: Olmo clearance doesn't mar LaLiga
content: Real Madrid coach Carlo Ancelotti does not believe the decision to allow Barcelona's Dani Olmo and Pau Víctor to continue playing for the club will taint any competition, with his team potentially facing Barça for three trophies.

title: Mbappé, Rüdiger avoid bans; available vs Arsenal
content: Real Madrid's Antonio Rüdiger and Kylian Mbappé have been cleared by UEFA to play for next week's Champions League quarterfinal first leg at Arsenal.

title: De Bruyne one of PL's greatest players - Pep
content: Pep Guardiola has lauded Kevin De Bruyne's impact on the Premier League, adding the midfielder's exit is a "sad day" for the club.

title: Spurs' Ange: Cupped ear 'mistake' caused VAR
content: Tottenham's Ange Postecoglou has said he will likely watch less football once he finishes his coaching career as he continues to admonish VAR.

title: Arsenal's Arteta on Gabriel injury: We can cope
content: Mikel Arteta has claimed Arsenal "have the resources to cope" with Gabriel Magalhaes' season-ending injury, hinting both Ben White and Jurriën Timber could soon return to action.

title: Maresca: My mistake nearly cost Chelsea win
content: Chelsea boss Enzo Maresca said he could have blown his side's chances of hanging on for a 1-0 win over Tottenham Hotspur on Thursday.

title: 'The most unique quarterback story I've ever heard': How Luis Perez became 'The Spring King'
content: UFL QB Luis Perez has chronicled his unique journey in a book as he pushes for a final chapter in the NFL.

title: How Gabriela Jaquez shifted focus during Final Four run
content: Gabriela Jaquez is chasing history with UCLA after spending her summer doing the same with Team Mexico.

title: The next big thing: Day is embracing his new 'job' in NASCAR
content: Outside of dirt races, Corey Day's schedule used to be wide open. That's not the case now that he's in NASCAR.

title: UFC Fight Night expert picks, best bets: How Lerone Murphy remains unbeaten
content: Who prevails in this week's UFC Fight Night and PFL First Round? An MMA coach and a betting insider make their picks.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United make Italy striker Lucca new target
content: Udinese and Italy striker Lorenzo Lucca has emerged as a leading summer target for Manchester United. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Immigration and Foreigners Bill gets president's assent, becomes law
content: The legislation empowers the central government to exert control over places that are "frequented by any foreigner" and requires the owner to close the premises, permit its use under specified conditions, or refuse admission to all or a "specified class" of foreigners.

title: Army’s MRSAM flight tested four times
content: According to DRDO, the MRSAM’s successfull interception and destruction of all designated targets “paved the way for operationalisation of weapon systems”.

title: Waqf Bill: Narrow margin of defeat in Rajya Sabha surprises Opposition
content: The INDIA bloc has only 81 members and at least six of them were absent during voting; additional votes were contributed by AIADMK and the non-INDIA bloc Opposition parties such as BJD, YSR Congress and BRS

title: NIA opposes Anand Teltumbde’s plea to travel abroad, cites risk of absconding
content: The accused scholar filed a plea to travel to the Netherlands and the U.K. for academic reasons; NIA denied on the grounds of his alleged involvment with CPI (Maoist).

title: Maharashtra govt to crack down on ‘huge Waqf land scam’: CM Fadnavis
content: Waqf bill has nothing to do with Hindutva, says Fadnavis, adding that provisions of the amended law are in the ‘constitutional spirit of a democratic, socialist Republic of India’

title: Governor gives Karnataka govt. one-month deadline to appoint RDPR varsity Vice-Chancellor
content: Thaawarchand Gehlot said in his letter addressed to Chief Minister Siddaramaiah that until the Karnataka State Rural Development and Panchayat Raj University (Amendment) Bill is cleared, the vice-chancellor has to be appointed as per the existing law

title: Rahul Gandhi to visit Bihar on April 7; Jan Suraaj Party to hold rally in Patna on April 11
content: Congress party leader is expected to participate in a seminar on “Safeguarding the Constitution” in Patna and may also visit Begusarai to support Kanhaiya Kumar’s padayatra

title: Teacher transferred; two cooks suspended for caning student over egg distribution in Tiruvannamalai
content: A probe led by the Block Educational Officer, found the student asked about the non-distribution of eggs, when he along with other students saw racks of eggs in the kitchen

title: Activists call for ceasefire in Naxal areas after Maoists make conditional offer for peace talks
content: The government must stop war on the ground immediately, Maoists must end hostilities against State forces, use of IEDs, activists say; insist residents of tribal districts must be top priority in any peace talks

title: Trump tariffs | Sectors in India that find themselves in a spotlight
content: The White House held these tariffs strived to “strengthen the international economic position of United States and protect American workers”

title: Office space leasing in Chennai sees growth, records 2.6 million sq.ft in first quarter of 2025
content: CBRE South Asia Private Limited, in its report, says key sectors that contributed include technology (32%), fast-moving consumer goods and retail (19%), and flexible space operators (14%)

title: Four more JD(U) leaders resign after party supports Waqf Bill
content: In one of the resignation letters, it is mentioned that its effect would be visible in the upcoming Bihar Assembly election 2025 and soon there will be a stir in JD(U) due to widespread discontent

title: Jaipur court convicts four persons in 2008 live bomb case
content: The live bomb detected near the Ramchandra temple in Chandpole Bazaar, for which the four persons were held guilty, was defused before it could explode

title: Will stand with Muslim community if amended Waqf law is misused: Mayawati
content: Former UP CM questions the government’s extreme hurry in clearing the Bill and states that the people needed more time to understand the Bill in its entirety

title: "They Played It Wrong, Panicked": Trump On China's Tariff Retaliation
content: President Donald Trump goaded a "panicked" China on Friday after the chief US economic rival retaliated against his tariffs and he dismissed stock market panic over the growing global trade war, touting the chance to "get rich."

title: K Annamalai To Step Down As Tamil Nadu BJP Chief? He Says...
content: Adding fuel to speculation that he may be replaced as the president of the Tamil Nadu BJP, K Annamalai has said that he is not in the running to be the next state chief of the party.

title: US Moves Largest B-2 Bomber Fleet, 3 Aircraft Carriers To Indo-Pacific
content: While the world was busy figuring out Donald Trump's reciprocal tariff move and its fallout, the United States quietly made a massive military move in the Indian Ocean and Indo-Pacific region.

title: Indian Startup Bosses On Piyush Goyal's "Dukandaari Hi Karna Hain?" Question
content: Union Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal's note to Indian startups - asking them to shift focus from food delivery to more advanced technological solutions - has led to a debate online.

title: "Using Parliament Majority To Take Muslims' Rights": A Owaisi On Waqf Bill
content: AIMIM chief and MP Asaduddin Owaisi filed a petition in the Supreme Court against the Waqf (Amendment) Bill which was passed by the Rajya Sabha last night.

title: Actor Vijay Fishes In Troubled Waters, Calls For Katchatheevu's Retrieval
content: Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam (TVK) chief and actor Vijay has called on Prime Minister Narendra Modi to assert India's sovereignty over the Katchatheevu Island ahead of his upcoming visit to Sri Lanka.

title: Huge Protests In Kolkata, Chennai After Waqf Bill Clears Parliament
content: Thousands of protesters gathered on the streets of Kolkata, Chennai, and Ahmedabad Friday afternoon - after weekly prayers by the Muslim community - to protest the Waqf Amendment Bill passed by Parliament this week.

title: IPL LIVE: Pant Left Fuming After LSG Pacer's Mistake. Suryakumar Nears 50
content: Lucknow Super Giants vs Mumbai Indians LIVE Score, IPL 2025: MI's run chase was rescued by a superb partnership between Naman Dhir and Suryakumar Yadav, chasing 204 vs LSG.

title: "Dangerous": Harvard Professor Sounds Alert As Markets Lose Trillions
content: US stock futures fell sharply today, signalling more losses on Wall Street, after China retaliated with fresh tariffs a day after the Trump administration's sweeping levies knocked off $2.4 trillion from US equities.

title: Man Serves Jail Time Over Wife's Murder, She Turns Up Alive In Court
content: A court here has ordered the Superintendent of Police (SP) to submit a complete report before April 17 in connection with a case in which a woman, allegedly murdered by her husband in 2020, has now appeared before it-alive.

title: "Biggest Fraud": Rishabh Pant Roasted Brutally As Poor Run Continues For LSG
content: Rishabh Pant's poor run in IPL 2025 is turning into a terrible one. He has scored only 19 runs in four matches.

title: Watch: Microsoft CEOs Gates, Nadella And Ballmer 'Roasted' By Copilot AI
content: The conversation kicks off with Nadella asking the Copilot to "wrap it up by asking or maybe roast giving us each an AI roast?" to which Microsoft's AI-powered assistant says, "Alright, Satya. Let's spice it up."

title: Billionaires Lost $208 Billion After Tariff Announcement, Biggest Loser Is...
content: The drop is the fourth-largest one-day decline in the Billionaires Index's 13-year history, and the largest since the peak of the Covid-19 pandemic.

title: Trump's Tariff Move To Make Things Costlier For Americans. Here's The List
content: Experts warn that President Trump's new tariffs, which include a 10-200 percent increase on imports, will drive up prices on a range of everyday products. Shoppers are advised to buy essential items now before the tariffs take full effect.

title: Manipur crisis: Kuki-Zo, Meitei civil society groups to meet in Delhi
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah says both the communities in Manipur should understand that dialogue is the only way forward and the Union government is not in favour of continuing President’s Rule even for a single day

title: Union Minister inaugurates public utilities funded by RVF in West Godavari district
content: Drinking water pond, RO water plant, and classrooms were among the facilities provided by the foundation at Ganapavaram village and Unguturu Assembly constituency

title: Congress launches Manmohan Singh Fellowship programme to help professionals transition into politics
content: Under the fellowship, 50 mid-career professionals will be chosen every year and mentored by senior party leaders from professional backgrounds;  the chosen professionals should have spent a minimum 10 years, attained a certain level of financial security and are passionate about building a progressive India

title: Srinagar’s Jama Masjid closed for Friday prayers; NC MP says ‘denied space to speak on Waqf Bill’
content: Terming the Bill as “state-sponsored dispossession”, a National Conference MP said the ruling BJP pushed the Bill through Parliament without allowing space for critics to “voice their concerns”

title: A cultural treat on a Rajamahendravaram street
content: The works of artists and traditional artisans stole the hearts of art lovers in the city at the Amaravathi Chitra Kala Veedhi, a national art festival, held along the stretch of the Central Prison

title: Seafood exports from A.P. hit following  Trump’s tariff hike
content: Shipment of seafood products was halted for the last 24 hours on Friday; farmers, exporters keeping their fingers crossed as duty has been raised to 26 per cent

title: Kadapa Steel Plant not off agenda, says A.P. Industries Minister Bharath
content: He and Minister for MSMEs Srinivas release operational guidelines and launch Early Bird Portal pertaining to three policies

title: Revenue Minister launches slot booking service at 26 sub-registrar offices in Andhra Pradesh
content: Sellers, buyers, and witnesses can visit the office at the chosen time and complete the registration process smoothly, says Satya Prasad

title: Govt. to prioritise toilet construction in villages within boundaries of eco-sensitive zones to reduce human-animal conflict
content: The order comes in response to wildlife biologist Sanjay Gubbi’s recent letter to Priyank Kharge, urging him to prioritise villages within eco-sensitive zones for essential sanitation initiatives

title: ‘Efforts to develop harmonious relationships with neighbouring states should increase’
content: Seven candidates got D.Lit and 198 candidates got Ph.D degrees at the convocation at the 33rd Convocation of Kannada University in Hampi

title: Nuclear Powered Rockets May Make Trip To Mars Faster, More Efficient: Report
content: A revolution in spaceflight is in the offing. British startup Pulsar Fusion has unveiled its nuclear fusion-powered rocket, the Sunbird, CNN reported.

title: Set up 100-bed hospitals in every Assembly constituency and offer need-based virtual services at PHCs, CHCs, Andhra Pradesh CM Naidu tells officials
content: Incentives and subsidies can be given to the private firms that come forward to construct and operate these hospitals under PPP model, he says; he also asks officials to take steps to establish a Mega Global MediCity Project in Amaravati

title: Kerala govt. notifies Energy Conservation and Sustainable Building Code Rules
content: The provisions are applicable to commercial buildings with a connected load of 100 kW or more, or a contract demand of 120 kVA or more

title: Chief Minister moots comprehensive policy to make education more efficient and effective
content: The Education Commission asked to recommend policies to revamp the education system in the State; Chief Minister emphasised that the document should  reflect the ground realities and effort be made to see that the recommendations are implementable

title: Civil Supplies Minister promises to procure every paddy grain from farmers
content: The government had procured 74,000 metric tonnes of paddy from 7,000 farmers and ₹154 crore was credited to the farmers’ accounts within 24-48 hours, says Nadendla Manohar

title: Asaduddin Owaisi challenges waqf legislation in Supreme Court
content: Consultation in connection with legal recourse and protest against waqf legislation underway: All India Muslim Personal Law Board

title: 263 polling booths, including 59 new ones, likely for Nilambur bypoll
content: New permanent polling booths will be established in the place of auxiliary booths for areas with large voter population ahead of the Nilambur by-election.

title: Telangana to move Supreme Court against A.P.’s Godavari-Krishna link projects, says Minister
content: The State won’t remain a mute spectator to construction of illegal projects to divert river waters to non-basin areas at the cost of needs in basin areas in Telangana, says Uttam Kumar Reddy

title: 70% of maternal deaths in Karnataka between April and December of 2024 were preventable, finds audit report
content: The report was submitted by a government-constituted committee which was formed following the maternal deaths in Ballari

title: Trial traffic reforms on Chalakudy national highway from April 5
content: Traffic snarl-ups on the Chalakudy-Chirangara section of the National Highway 544 due to work on underpasses and overbridges

title: Fire breaks out in battery gallery at A.P. Secretariat; Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu directs security audit
content: Government orders inquiry into the blaze that occurred in Block-2; as per preliminary assessment, short circuit is said to be the reason; further action after forensic report, says Home Minister Anitha

title: Kiren Rijiju defends decision to hold debate on Manipur past midnight
content: The Parliamentary Affairs Minister says that the Opposition had been taken on board about the decision.

title: Drones, CCTVs, and 20,000 policemen to monitor Sri Ram Navami Shobha Yatra on April 6
content: A joint control room will be set up in the Integrated Command Control Centre (ICCC) building to monitor the Shobha Yatra

title: Collector issues order to tranquillize leopard spotted in Chalakudy
content: An emergency meeting was held following the sighting of the leopard in a residential area in Chalakudy

title: Poor show by many local bodies in Plan fund utilisation in Kozhikode
content: Only 13 local bodies in district could achieve the 100% target; lack of timely planning and delay in implementing spill-over projects cited as prime reasons

title: Health university and NSDC sign MoU to upskill nursing students for overseas jobs
content: Nursing students and graduates will receive specialised training to secure placements in countries such as Germany, the United Kingdom, and Canada without any intermediaries

title: Allahabad HC declines to quash summons against Rahul Gandhi in Savarkar defamation case
content: The petitioner alleged that the Congress leader had made derogatory remarks against the Hindutva ideologue during his Bharat Jodo Yatra in Maharashtra last year

title: Minister Parthasarathy assures vigilance probe into ‘housing scam’
content: The Housing Minister responds after a group of beneficiaries of the Jagananna Housing Scheme inform him that the houses sanctioned to them were never built and that their signatures were forged to withdraw crores of rupees from their accounts

title: CM’s daughter Veena may be issued notice in CMRL pay-off case
content: Additional District and Sessions Judge 7, Ernakulam, will issue summons to the accused.  They will have to personally appear before the special court and seek bail. Arrests are unlikely to be made in the case as the investigation agency has completed its probe and filed the final complaint, according to legal sources

title: Exhibition on feminist, democratic histories at BIC
content: Hosted at BIC from March 29 to April 6, the exhibition features archival fragments that trace networks of activism, solidarity, and political imagination from the mid-20th century onwards.

title: ‘Tiger Triumph’ on Indian coast a skill-enhancing experience, say crew of U.S. ships
content: The harbour phase of the joint amphibious humanitarian assistance disaster response exercise to continue up to April 7 and the sea phase till April 12

title: Assam to drop cases against Koch-Rajbongshis in Foreigners’ Tribunals
content: The community, which inhabits large swathes of Assam and northern West Bengal, is one of six seeking Scheduled Tribe status in Assam

title: De Bruyne to leave Man City at end of season

title: Harry Kane is on a mission to finally end his long personal trophy drought
content: despite winning trophies and featuring in five finals, Harry Kane has never won a major club trophy . the 33-time german league champion has never tasted victory in a competition . he says he is a man on a mission to win silverware of note . his first year with Bayern Munich ended trophy-less, an unusual feat .

title: Your guide to the men's Final Four: Auburn-Florida, Duke-Houston (with picks!)
